chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
n: nat
l: pos n
h: pos n
a: pos n
s: pos n
Hsa: s <> a
Hsh: s <> h
Hsl: s <> l
Hah: a <> h
Hal: a <> l
Hhl: h <> l
lt: list (list bool * list bool)
p: nat
i: nat
lFD: nat
pre: Vector.t (list bool) n -> Prop
spec: Vector.t (list bool) n -> Vector.t (list bool) n -> Prop
f: Vector.t (list bool) n -> Vector.t (list bool) n
Hf: forall v : Vector.t (list bool) n, v <> f v
C2: Vector.t (list bool) n -> Prop
C1: Vector.t (list bool) n -> Prop
HC: forall v : Vector.t (list bool) n, pre v -> {C1 v} + {C2 v}
Hp: out_code p (i, main_loop)
w: Vector.t (list bool) n
v: Vector.t (list bool) n
q: nat

Goal:
v#>s = Zero :: nil -> v#>h = nil -> v#>l = nil -> v#>a = nil -> out_code q (i, main_loop) -> (i, main_loop) // (i, v) ->> (q, w) -> p = q /\ (forall x : pos n, x <> s -> x <> a -> x <> h -> x <> l -> v#>x = w#>x) /\ tiles_solvable lt

Premises:

Notation Zero := false
main_loop = copy_stack s a h i ++ full_decoder a h l (lFD + 16 + i) (lFD + 26 + i) (16 + i) lt ++ compare_stacks h l (lFD + 16 + i) p (lFD + 26 + i) ++ increment_erase (lFD + 26 + i) i : list (bsm_instr n)

decoder_spec_rec : forall c h l : pos n, c <> h -> c <> l -> h <> l -> forall (q s i : nat) (mm ll : list (list bool * list bool)) (th tl : list bool) (lr : list (list bool * list bool)) (lc : list bool) v (w : nat * vec (list bool) n), v#>c = list_repeat Zero (length ll) ++ One :: lc -> mm = ll ++ (th, tl) :: lr -> w = (s, v[lc/c][(th ++ v#>h)/h][(tl ++ v#>l)/l]) -> (i, decoder c h l q s i mm) // (i, v) -> > w
full_dec_spec_rec2 : forall c h l : pos n, c <> h -> forall (p q i k : nat) (lt : list (list bool * list bool)) v, v#>c = list_repeat Zero (S k) -> exists w : vec (list bool) n, (i, full_decoder c h l p q i lt) // (i, v) -> > (q, w) /\ (forall z : pos n, z <> c -> z <> h -> z <> l -> v#>z = w#>z)
decoder_spec_ok : forall c h l : pos n, c <> h -> c <> l -> h <> l -> forall (q s i : nat) (ll : list (list bool * list bool)) (th tl : list bool) (lr : list (list bool * list bool)) (lc : list bool) v (st : nat * vec (list bool) n), v#>c = list_repeat Zero (length ll) ++ One :: lc -> st = (s, v[lc/c][(th ++ v#>h)/h][(tl ++ v#>l)/l]) -> (i, decoder c h l q s i (ll ++ (th, tl) :: lr)) // (i, v) -> > st
full_dec_spec_rec1 : forall c h l : pos n, c <> h -> c <> l -> h <> l -> forall (p q i : nat) (ln : list nat) (lc : list bool) (lt : list (list bool * list bool)) v, v#>c = list_nat_bool ln ++ lc -> Exists (fun x : nat => length lt <= x) ln -> exists w : vec (list bool) n, (i, full_decoder c h l p q i lt) // (i, v) -> > (q, w) /\ (forall z : pos n, z <> c -> z <> h -> z <> l -> v#>z = w#>z)
full_decoder_ko_spec : forall c h l : pos n, c <> h -> c <> l -> h <> l -> forall (p q i : nat) (ln : list nat) (lc : list bool) (lt : list (list bool * list bool)) v, v#>c = list_nat_bool ln ++ lc -> Exists (fun x : nat => length lt <= x) ln \/ Forall (fun x : nat => x < length lt) ln /\ (exists k : nat, lc = list_repeat Zero (S k)) -> exists w : vec (list bool) n, (i, full_decoder c h l p q i lt) // (i, v) -> > (q, w) /\ (forall z : pos n, z <> c -> z <> h -> z <> l -> v#>z = w#>z)
cs_spec_rec : forall x y : pos n, x <> y -> forall (i p q : nat) (l m : list bool) v, v#>x = l -> v#>y = m -> exists w : vec (list bool) n, (forall z : pos n, z <> x -> z <> y -> v#>z = w#>z) /\ (l = m -> (i, compare_stacks x y i p q) // (i, v) ->> (p, w)) /\ (l <> m -> (i, compare_stacks x y i p q) // (i, v) ->> (q, w))
compare_stack_neq_spec : forall x y : pos n, x <> y -> forall (i p q : nat) v, v#>x <> v#>y -> exists w : vec (list bool) n, (i, compare_stacks x y i p q) // (i, v) -> > (q, w) /\ (forall z : pos n, z <> x -> z <> y -> v#>z = w#>z)
copy_stack_spec : forall x y z : pos n, x <> y -> x <> z -> y <> z -> forall (i : nat) (l : list bool) (v w : vec (list bool) n), v#>x = l -> v#>z = nil -> w = v[(l ++ v#>y)/y] -> (i, copy_stack x y z i) // (i, v) -> > (16 + i, w)
compare_stack_eq_spec : forall x y : pos n, x <> y -> forall (i p q : nat) v, v#>x = v#>y -> exists w : vec (list bool) n, (i, compare_stacks x y i p q) // (i, v) -> > (p, w) /\ (forall z : pos n, z <> x -> z <> y -> v#>z = w#>z)
full_decoder_ok_spec : forall c h l : pos n, c <> h -> c <> l -> h <> l -> forall (p q i : nat) (ln : list nat) (lt : list (list bool * list bool)) v, v#>c = list_nat_bool ln -> v#>h = nil -> v#>l = nil -> Forall (fun x : nat => x < length lt) ln -> let (hh, ll) := tile_concat ln lt in (i, full_decoder c h l p q i lt) // (i, v) -> > (p, v[nil/c][hh/h][ll/l])
compare_stack_spec : forall x y : pos n, x <> y -> forall (i p q : nat) v, exists (j : nat) (w : vec (list bool) n), (i, compare_stacks x y i p q) // (i, v) -> > (j, w) /\ (forall z : pos n, z <> x -> z <> y -> v#>z = w#>z /\ (v#>x = v#>y /\ j = p \/ v#>x <> v#>y /\ j = q))
main_loop_complete_rec : forall (v w : vec (list bool) n) (q : nat), pre v -> out_code q (i, main_loop) -> (i, main_loop) // (i, v) -> > (q, w) -> p = q /\ (exists n0 : nat, C2 (iter f v n0) /\ spec (iter f v n0) w)
copy_rev_stack_spec : forall x y z : pos n, x <> y -> x <> z -> y <> z -> forall (i : nat) (l : list bool) (v w : vec (list bool) n), v#>x = l -> w = v[nil/x][(rev l ++ v#>y)/y][(rev l ++ v#>z)/z] -> (i, copy_rev_stack x y z i) // (i, v) -> > (9 + i, w)
transfer_ones_spec_1 : forall x y : pos n, x <> y -> forall (i p q : nat) (b : bool) (k : nat) (l : list bool) v (st : nat * vec (list bool) n), v#>x = list_repeat One k ++ Zero :: l -> st = (p, v[l/x][(list_repeat b k ++ v#>y)/y]) -> (i, transfer_ones x y i p q b) // (i, v) -> > st
bsm_steps_POP_E_inv : forall (n a : nat) (P : nat * list (bsm_instr n)) (i : nat) (x : pos n) (p q : nat) (v : vec (list bool) n) (st : nat * vec (list bool) n), (i, POP x p q :: nil) <sc P -> v#>x = nil -> st <> (i, v) -> P // (i, v) -[a] -> st -> {b : nat | b < a /\ P // (q, v) -[b] -> st}
transfer_ones_spec_2 : forall x y : pos n, x <> y -> forall (i p q : nat) (b : bool) (k : nat) v (st : nat * vec (list bool) n), v#>x = list_repeat One k -> st = (q, v[nil/x][(list_repeat b k ++ v#>y)/y]) -> (i, transfer_ones x y i p q b) // (i, v) -> > st
bsm_steps_POP_any_inv : forall (n a : nat) (P : nat * list (bsm_instr n)) (i : nat) (x : pos n) (p q : nat) (b : bool) (ll : list bool) (v : vec (list bool) n) (st : nat * vec (list bool) n), (i, POP x p q :: nil) <sc P -> v#>x = b :: ll -> p = 1 + i -> st <> (i, v) -> P // (i, v) -[a] -> st -> {b0 : nat | b0 < a /\ P // (1 + i, v[ll/x]) -[b0] -> st}
full_dec_spec_rec : forall c h l : pos n, c <> h -> c <> l -> h <> l -> forall (p q i : nat) (ln : list nat) (lc : list bool) (lt : list (list bool * list bool)) v, v#>c = list_nat_bool ln ++ lc -> Forall (fun x : nat => x < length lt) ln -> let (hh, ll) := tile_concat ln lt in (i, full_decoder c h l p q i lt) // (i, v) -> > (i, v[lc/c][(hh ++ v#>h)/h][(ll ++ v#>l)/l])
move_rev_stack_spec : forall x y : pos n, x <> y -> forall (i : nat) (l : list bool) (v w : vec (list bool) n), v#>x = l -> w = v[nil/x][(rev l ++ v#>y)/y] -> (i, move_rev_stack x y i) // (i, v) -> > (7 + i, w)
bsm_steps_POP_0_inv : forall (n a : nat) (P : nat * list (bsm_instr n)) (i : nat) (x : pos n) (p q : nat) (ll : list bool) (v : vec (list bool) n) (st : nat * vec (list bool) n), (i, POP x p q :: nil) <sc P -> v#>x = Zero :: ll -> st <> (i, v) -> P // (i, v) -[a] -> st -> {b : nat | b < a /\ P // (p, v[ll/x]) -[b] -> st}
